snippet: Horace Kelly, convicted of murdering two women and an 11-year-old boy in 1984, was granted a new hearing today by a Federal court of appeals, blocking his execution, scheduled for July 7.    The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit...
lead_paragraph: Horace Kelly, convicted of murdering two women and an 11-year-old boy in 1984, was granted a new hearing today by a Federal court of appeals, blocking his execution, scheduled for July 7. The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, here in San Francisco, said a majority of its 21 active judges had voted to refer Mr. Kelly's case to an 11-judge panel for a rehearing at a date not yet scheduled. The panel is to decide whether a deadline in a new Federal law bars Mr. Kelly, 38, from a Federal appeal of his convictions and two death sentences.
abstract: United States Appeals Court grants new hearing to Horace Kelly, convicted of three 1984 California murders, blocking his execution (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Appeals Court Blocks Execution in California
